source_dir_tip:
Add directory to be copied. The
field on the right can also be filled
directly (e.g. Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V).
source_files_tip:
Add file(s) to be copied.
The field can also be filled
directly (e.g. Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V).
source_multiple_tip:
Add multiple files or directories to be copied.
The field on the right can also be filled
directly (e.g. Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V).
source_text_tip:
Select source directories and files to copy.
Write or copy (e.g. Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V) the paths
into the field or use dialogs under the
buttons 'Directory' and 'File'.
destination_tip:
Select the destination directory for the recursive copy operation.
The field can also be filled directly (e.g. Ctrl+V).
hash_tip:
Select hash algorithms if calculation is desired.
These will be saved in a CSV file in the log directory.
verify_tip:
Select verification method (file size or hash value).
After copying with Robocopy.exe, a comparison with
the source files can be performed.
log_tip:
Select the directory for logging and possibly CSV file.
If the entry is left empty, no log will be created (except
lastlog.txt in the application directory). The field can also
be filled directly (e.g. Ctrl+V).
help_text:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Robocopy GUI is a graphical user interface for the Windows Robocopy.exe.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Robocopy is a command-line tool for copying files and directories.
It is part of the Windows operating system.

The GUI has the additional option to calculate hashes and verify copied files (by hash or file size).
You can find the native help text above here in this field (scroll!) to understand the options.
Only some are available in this GUI.

This is free and open source software (GPL-3).
admin_tip:
The application is running as administrator.
Be careful where you copy stuff.
no_admin_tip:
You have no administrator privileges.
Some options might not work and/or
restricted areas might be inaccessible.
simulate_tip:
Shows which files would be created without actually copying.
During the simulation, it can be aborted with this button.
exec_tip:
Start the recursive copy process. The
directories and files to be copied are
read from the field above.
language_tip:
Change the language of the application.
Restart the application to apply the changes.
shutdown_tip: Shut down the computer when finished.
quit_tip:
Exit the application or interrupt a
running Robocopy process.
shutdown_warning:
Are you sure you want to shut down the computer
when process is complete?
ask_clear_source: Do you want to clear the source field?
select_destination: Select the destination directory to copy to
no_source: Source directories and/or files were not selected.
destination_not_empty:
Destination directory # is not empty,
files could be overwritten.
Continue anyway?
source_collides_destination:
Source path

#

collides with destination directory

&
config_error: Unable to save configuration, unable to start Robocopy
no_destination: Path to destination directory is missing
reading_source: Reading structure of files and directories to be copied
invalid_paths: # invalid path(s) that could not be hashed and/or verified
starting_size_verification: Starting verification based on file size
starting_hash_verification: Starting verification based on hash value
size_check_finished: Verification based on file size is complete
all_done: All done, process took # (hours, minutes, seconds)
abort_warning:
Robocopy is running!
Do you want to abort?
